intro: Seseli pimpinelloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, compound umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a narrow, lance-shaped appearance. Seseli pimpinelloides is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, thriving in cool, dry climates.
